Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the commodity and dated year 10; covered inside and out with a waxy substance, apparently from earlier conservation treatment (?).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:21-22/163 Workmen's Village
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I:164 pl.LXIII, fig.C
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393137) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393137)
